_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:15:02 using v2.1
title: How do quit rates vary by gender and ethnicity?
analysis_commentary:
Between April and December 2013, the ethnic groups with the highest quit rates are 'Pakistani' (59%), 'any other white background' (53%), 'any other Asian background' (53%) and 'Indian' (53%). The lowest are 'any other Black background' (42%), 'White and Black African' (44%) and 'White and Black Caribbean' (45%).

Generally males have a higher quit rate than females with 53% of males quitting and 50% of females in total Apr-Dec 2013. If we look at this gender split by ethnicity, males have higher quit rates than females in all ethnic groups apart from Bangladeshi.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Statistics on NHS Stop Smoking Services in England
